places_with_reviews.name: Avchitgad Fort
places_with_reviews.address: F4G9+274, Nidi Tarf Ashtami, Maharashtra 402109, India

reviews.text: "Avachitgad fort is a historical gem nestled amidst breathtaking natural beauty. The trek to reach the fort is an adventure in itself, offering stunning vistas and a sense of exploration. The fort's ruins stand as a testament to its rich history, evoking a deep sense of awe and wonder. The panoramic views from the top are simply mesmerizing, making the trek worth every step. For history enthusiasts and nature lovers alike, Avachitgad fort is an absolute must-visit, offering an unforgettable experience that seamlessly blends history, adventure, and scenic beauty."

A good historical fort as we can see some thrilling old structures. I like the fort the most. The trekking is easy, though. A small but must visit place for all treck lovers. I recommend visiting if you are a bigginner. The trecking path is easy for even small kidd as well.

Good silent place for a small trek.
Do stay at VARDHANI, Medhe ... amazing place !!!

Avchitgad fort is in roha town.

One need to reach the village and park your vehicle near Vitthal mandir where the road end.

Walk for some time on that mud trail until you reach a well.

The trail to the fort starts behind the well.

The trail is well marked and it takes and hour max to reach the Mahadarwaja.

On the first pleateu there are few veerghal which are arrange properly under a tree.

Avchitgad has a ballekilla which has separate darwaja which is in ruins now.

There are around 7 canons on the fort.

There are 2 massive buruj on two ends of the fort.

There is set of 5-6 water cristern on the fort, there is a small single cistern on the western end and other cistern which is carved inside the main fortification.

There is a massive water tank or well which has a small shiv temple near it.

It takes around an hour to explore the whole fort.

places_with_reviews.name: Shree Dhavir Maharaj Temple.
places_with_reviews.address: C4Q7+W4M Shree Dhavir Maharaj Mandir, Wali, Roha, Maharashtra 402109, India

reviews.text:
1.5km from the town is the temple of Shri Dhaveer Maharaj. The original place of the idol further.
Beautifully maintained with a garden and other amenities, it is a place to spend a quiet evening or morning with blessings.

Dhavir maharajTemple. Dhavir Maharaj is the prime deity of Roha. Every year the town celebrates Navaratri Festival by having a 10 day Festival at the Dhavir Temple which ends on the 10th day - "Dasra" during Navaratri. On the following day of Dasra, Palkhi of Dhavir Maharaj is taken through the town where it visits each and every house for the Aarti.The Dhavir Temple was built by Balwantrao Vithoji More in 1849. There are two stories told about how Dhavir Maharaj became Roha's Gramdaivat.

Before leaving the Dhavir temple to begin the Dhavir Palkhi, it was given 'SALAMI' by the Raigad Police. Salami means police stand in a line and fire bullets from their rifles.
Spiritual and peaceful temple also atmosphere. Shree Dhavir Maharaj is Roha's "Gramdaivat".

The best place seen in Roha. Temple is built up with Marbles. Dhaveer Maharaj mandir is a famous thing in Roha. Dhavir palkhi is celebrated after next day of Dahsera. People come here with hopes and there wishes get completed. There is a residential facility also available called as Bhakta Nivas.

Sacred place of Shree Dhavir Maharaj.
Very quiet place to spend some time around the temple.
One of two places in Roha where you will always fill to come back.

places_with_reviews.name: Hanuman Tekadi Temple.
places_with_reviews.address: C4Q7+2M8, Maharashtra State Highway 97, Wali, Roha, Maharashtra 402109, India

reviews.text:
If you are looking for a peaceful place in Roha, visit Hanuman Tekdi. The Hanuman Mandir is neat and clean.

In evenings, you can see the best of the sunsets here. There is nice breeze in the evening, extremely fresh air, full of oxygen. You will feel refreshed. Children will have a nice time running around and playing up and down the steps.

You will see a good view of entire Roha from top.

People also go to the Tekdi daily by walking in the morning for exercise.

You can also walk down to the Dhavir temple from here via a short trek.

All in all, a fantastic place in Roha.

Picturesque and peaceful spot to spend some quality time with friends and loved ones, I highly recommend checking out Hanuman Tekadi in Roha, Raigad. This location is truly a hidden gem and offers breathtaking views of the entire Roha city.

The old Hanuman temple located here is also a sight to behold, with beautiful and intricate carvings that are sure to impress. But what really sets this place apart is the natural beauty that surrounds it. You'll find yourself surrounded by lush greenery, fresh air and a sense of calm that is hard to come by in the hustle and bustle of city life.

Visiting in the evening around 4pm, when the sun begins to set and the sky is painted with beautiful hues of orange and pink. It's the perfect time to enjoy the stunning views and spend some quality time with friends and loved ones.

Hanuman Tekadi in Roha, Raigad is an excellent choice for a hangout spot with friends and partners. Whether you're looking to enjoy some peaceful moments or to simply take in the beauty of nature, this spot is sure to leave you feeling refreshed and rejuvenated.
Use to be my family's go-to place on weekends. Right now, it's not in great shape.
This is a beautiful place in roha district
You can take a look of whole roha city from this temple if you want to take a cinematic shoot without dron then this is the right place
